revisions.rev:
'''Vasta Blackwood''' (born 17 January 1962, England) is a British television and film actor.
Blackwood played [[Lenny Henry]]'s sidekick Winston Churchill in ''The Lenny Henry Show'' (1987) and David Sinclair in ''[[Casualty (TV series)|Casualty]]'' (1996–97). Since playing [[Rory Breaker]] in the hit film ''[[Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels]]'' (1998) he has had a number of film roles, including ''[[Mean Machine (film)|Mean Machine]]'' (2001), ''[[9 Dead Gay Guys]]'' (2002) and ''[[Creep (movie)|Creep]]'' (2004). In 2005 he appeared in [[A Bear's Tail]], a spin off of ''[[Bo' Selecta!]]''. He also made an appearance as Lennox Gilbey in ''[[Only Fools and Horses]]''.
In 2008 he did voiceover work for Fable II on the Xbox 360 and PC.
